ar.com.hjg.pngj

Class ChunkReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ar.com.hjg.pngj.ChunkReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBytesConsumer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeflatedChunkReader

    public abstract class ChunkReader
extends Object
implements IBytesConsumer
    Parses a PNG chunk, consuming bytes in one of three modes: ChunkReader.ChunkReaderMode.BUFFER, ChunkReader.ChunkReaderMode.PROCESS, ChunkReader.ChunkReaderMode.SKIP.

    It calls chunkDone() when done. Also calls #processData(byte[], int, int) if PROCESS mode. Apart from thas, it's totally agnostic (it doesn't know about IDAT chunks, or PNG general structure)

    The object wraps a ChunkRaw instance (content allocated and filled only if BUFFER mode). It should be short lived (one instance created for each chunk, and discarded after reading), but the wrapped chunkRaw can be (usually is) long lived.

      • getChunkRaw

      • consume

        public final int consume(byte[] buf,
                         int off,
                         int len)
        Consumes data for the chunk (data and CRC). This only consumes bytes owned by this chunk (data + crc , not id+len prefix) In ChunkReaderMode.PROCESS can call processData() (not more than once) If this ends the chunk (included CRC) it checks CRC (if checking) and calls chunkDone()
        Specified by:
        consume in interface IBytesConsumer
        Parameters:
        buf -
        off -
        len -
        Returns:
        How many bytes have been consumed

        public final boolean isDone()
        Chunks has been read
        Specified by:
        isDone in interface IBytesConsumer
        Returns:
        true if we have read all chunk, including trailing CRC

      • setCrcCheck

        public void setCrcCheck(boolean crcCheck)
        Determines if CRC should be checked. This should be called before starting reading.
        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • processData

        protected abstract void processData(int offsetInchunk,
                                    byte[] buf,
                                    int off,
                                    int len)
        This method will only be called in PROCESS mode, probably several times, each time with a new fragment of data read from inside the chunk. For chunks with zero-length data, this will still be called once. It's guaranteed that the data corresponds exclusively to this chunk data (no crc, no data from no other chunks, )
        Parameters:
        offsetInchunk - data bytes that had already been read/processed for this chunk
        buf -
        off -
        len -

      • chunkDone

        protected abstract void chunkDone()
        This method will be called (in all modes) when the full chunk -including crc- has been read
